text: Door system type (swinging, sliding, automatic) matches approved shop drawings and schedules
Frames, operators, safety sensors, hardware, thresholds match submittals
Glazing type and thickness confirmed per code (tempered/laminated safety glass)
Finish and color of system components match architectural specs
Opening framed level, plumb, and square with sufficient embed/support for frame anchoring
Anchor embeds, blocking, wiring rough-ins installed prior to system arrival
Frame installed square, all perimeter sealed and shimmed
Door leaves aligned, operated manually before power-up
Panic hardware or locking mechanism functional and secure
Glazing installed without scratches, edge damage, or misalignment
Power wiring routed to operator and verified for voltage match
Motion sensors and safety presence sensors installed and tested
Push button (ADA) and activation zones tested with timed delay
Door closes securely and reopens on obstruction during test
Clear opening width ≥ 850 mm (per NBC/ADA)
Door swing or motion does not encroach on required path of travel
All hardware reachable between 34–48" above finished floor
System tested for full operation in power and manual mode
Manufacturer commissioning and start-up log completed
Consultant and envelope inspection (if applicable) signed off

id: • NBC Part 3 & 9, CSA B651 / ADA – Accessibility
• ANSI/BHMA A156.10 / A156.19 – Automatic Door Systems
• CAN/CGSB 82.1, ULC S104 / ULC S106 – Glazing & Doors
• Manufacturer Specs: Kawneer, Horton, Dorma, Stanley, Besam
